summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, covering three shifts on July 26, 2019. It details routine prison operations, counts, and security checks, with the primary notable entry being that inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was on psychological observation/suicide watch with an inmate companion. The log also notes a non-operational fire alarm system and the movement of other inmates.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as inmate #76318-054, noted as being on psychological observation/suicide watch with an inmate companion throughout the day.

persons.name: McIntyre
persons.context: Inmate #66881-054 who was transported out to court at 8:05 AM during the Day Watch shift.

persons.name: Rancier
persons.context: Inmate #69258-054 who was transported out to court at 8:05 AM along with inmate McIntyre.

persons.name: Turner
persons.context: Inmate #25352-083 who was taken to the hospital with BOP staff at 9:09 AM during the Day Watch shift.

persons.name: Sears
persons.context: Inmate #28569-057 who was released (FT REL) at 9:39 AM during the Day Watch shift.

events.title: Epstein on Suicide/Psychological Watch
events.description: Throughout the day's log entries, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) is noted as being on psychological observation (Psych Obs) or suicide watch, accompanied by another inmate.

events.title: Prison Fire System Inoperable
events.description: The log for all three shifts notes that the fire alarm and sprinkler system were non-operational, requiring a fire watch to be in progress.

events.title: Inmate Movements and Court Appearances
events.description: Routine inmate movements are logged, including inmates McIntyre and Rancier being taken to court, inmate Turner going to the hospital, and inmate Sears being released.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was on psychological observation/suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 26, 2019, and was accompanied by an inmate companion.
The prison's fire alarm and sprinkler system was non-operational on this date, necessitating a manual fire watch.
The log documents routine inmate counts, security checks, and the movement of several other inmates for court, hospital, and release.
The document is a standard prison operations log, showing the procedural environment in which Epstein was held prior to his death.
